summary: The Department of Energy depends on the expertise of firms, universities, and others to do much of its work, including managing and operating nuclear weapons labs. In 10 years, it spent about $193 billion on management and operating contracts. DOE generally gave these contractors high ratings and awarded over 90% of available performance incentives. However, we found DOE could do a better job reporting on...
title: Department of Energy: Performance Evaluations Could Better Assess Management and Operating Contractor Costs
